comment: Russian is a super difficult and complex language. I do feel at times that the class was rushed and some material was not covered thoroughly, but at the same time Prof. Solovjov was always accessible and willing to help; although she doesn't have "office hours," she is reachable at her email almost 24/7 and always replies quickly!
rating_tags: Participation matters--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS

comment: Ms. Solovjov is a good professor. The Russian language has a lot of rules and factors to consider so it'd be in your best interest to attend class and take notes. She does give a good bit of homework but it is necessary in order to grasp all of the concepts. I will say that she is very generous in her grading if you show some effort.
Russian is difficult, but Professor Solovjov is there for you. Prepare to study hard as that's the only way to learn a new language. If you do your HW and don't miss class, you will succeed.

Russian is a difficult language, but if you work hard, ask questions, and do the homework, you will succeed. If you expect to just show up for lectures and pass, you probably won't. You have to learn a new alphabet and an entirely different language structure. Ms. Solovjov knows this, is very reasonable, and does her best to help students succeed.

Most difficult professor I've had to date. Keeps telling us that she knows we're just learning, but the assignments don't make it seem that way. Gives you 20 minutes to take a 3-4 page test WITH WRITING (and this was just the first test). I know Russian is hard, but she moves way too fast. Had to drop the course. Wouldn't recommend her.
